title: How to publish my own light novel officially - Quora

response.answer_text: Learn Japanese.NEVER, and I MEAN IT, take/send your manuscripts to the Japanese Publishers, they just throw it away.Publish it on Japanese Web Novel websites, and hope, someone sees that your story, even if generic as the first line of thousands of herovsdemonking novels, is deemed that it can sell and then just talk it out with the guy.OR, you can try participating in the Light Novel Contests on those websites (The contests for newbies is the only way a new author makes his/her debut in Japan. Agents don’t help shit, Japan’s not the West)OR again, just try your hand in normal Light Novel or Literature Contests, not on web novel sites, but on the Publisher’s sites. This is will be the hardest to win, cuz other authors only choose this if they are absolutely serious about debuting as an author.

For English speakers, your best bet is to query either Vic’s Lab (USA) or Armoured Fox Press (Canada) as they are the only two publishers of light novels in North America that I know of. Otherwise, you can self publish, which can be a lot harder to do (as you have to learn a lot of different skills), but you also get to keep 100% of the profits. Just be aware that Vic’s Lab and AFP both have differing query methods, as AFP is closer to a standard small press and Vic’s Lab selects theirs through a contest held yearly. (their forum is a good place to test the waters for your light novel as you can get instant feedback from those who are reading your novel)
